SENT.plain: Falsely high automated platelet counts in a patient with aplastic anemia were found to be due to increased resistance of the red blood cells to urea lysis
Further investigation revealed that this phenomenon occurred with all of eight bloods of the phenotype Jk(a-b-) but not with red blood cells of other phenotypes tested
We therefore report an association of a rare blood group phenotype with unusual red blood cell behavior in vitro
